properties.author: Joachim Peer, Philip Grunikiewicz et al.
properties.title: DbForms Custom Tag Library

tag.name: dbform
tag.summary: a database application form (root element of a JSP view)
tag.info: this is the root element of a data manipulation form

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript (not supported by all browsers!)

info.p: the name of the table/view referenced by the dbform
not required if form is empty!
Override the servlet to which the dbform should be submitted
Default is the org.dbforms.Controller servlet
Rendering of read-only html widgets
Allows a user to specify a list of tables to select from
Used in conjuction with the whereClause attribute
Determines how many times the body tag and its sub-elements get executed (evaluated and rendered):

ul.li: maxRows = n => body gets executed n times (with n elementOF N)
maxRows = "*" => body gets executed for every row in the table (=> "endless" form)

info.p: not required if form is empty!
Free-form whereClause for select statement
orderBy information can also be specified
Disables navigation - optimizes queries
Caution: use this setting only if you do not intend on using dbforms navigation.

attribute.name: formValidatorName
attribute.info: this attribute contains the name of the form which is used for validation (defined in the validation.xml file).

attribute.name: captionResource
attribute.info: this attribute is to be used in conjunction with the internationalization support in dbForms v1.1+. It allows the developer to specify if the 'caption' attribute values, found in embedded button tags, should be looked up in the associated resource bundles. By default, this attribute is set to 'false'.

attribute.name: javascriptValidation
attribute.info: this attribute is used to specify if client-side validation (javascript) should be executed. By default, this attribute is set to 'false'. Default javascripts are defined in the validator-rules.xml file.

attribute.name: javascriptValidationSrcFile
attribute.info: this attribute allows a developer to specify a javascript file (.js) to be used for client-side validation. Default javascripts are defined in the validator-rules.xml file.

attribute.name: javascriptFieldsArray
attribute.info: this attribute is used to specify if dbForms should generate a javascript method which can be used by (javascript) developers for referencing dbform-generated field names . By default, this attribute is set to 'false'.

attribute.name: redisplayFieldsOnError
attribute.info: In a jsp which contains many input fields, it may be desirable, in the event of an error, to redisplay input data.(instead of refreshing the fields from the DB) DbForms implements this functionality by default with INSERT fields only. If you choose to set this attribute to "true" then DbForms will redisplay entered values even with UPDATES.

info.p: site to be invoked after action - nota bene: this followUp may be overruled by "followUp"-attributes of actionButtons
site to be invoked after action, if error occured on page - nota bene: this followUp may be overruled by "followUp"-attributes of actionButtons

if "true", at every action (navigation, insert, update, etc.) all input fields of ALL currentlyrendered rowsets are parsed and updated. many rows may be affected. This can be very useful if people need to change lots of data, even multiple datarows, at once
if "false", updates are only performed if an explicite "update"- action is launched(normally by hitting the updateAction-button). Up to 1 row may be affected.
used in sub-form: field(s) in the main form that is/are linked to this form
used in sub-form: field(s) in this form that is/are linked to the parent form
pendant to the html-target attribute in html-form tag: the target frame to jump to
multipart must be set to "true" if the form contains file-upload tags or if the form may be invoked by a form containing file-upload tags, orif it containts fields of BLOB or DISKBLOB.
default is "false" (multipart-support off)
a SQL orderBy-CLAUSE (without the keyword "ORDER BY")
example:

ul.li: if you do not specify it here, you may define it globally in your dbforms-config.xml file. If you do not specify any information, DbForms automatically takes the key-fields for sorting.
remember field names are CASE SENSITIVE in DbForms framework (at least in current version)

info.p: definition of a FILTER. Format: Fieldname/Fielvalue pairs, seperated by , or ; symbol.
examples:
since version 0.9, you can use <, > <= and >= operators, too!
the ~ symbol is an aquivalant to the SQL keyword "LIKE" used in SELECT statements!

allows to define a prefix applied to request parameters in order to provide a convenient and easyway of implementing navigation. Using this attribute may substitute the use of the more complicated and not very convenient GotoButton-Tag!
example:

ul.li: then you can call your jsp that way: customers.jsp?fv_id=4

info.p: => DbForms fetches the value of fv_ id which is "4" and then navigates to the row where id is 4.
this attribute was added in release 0.9
allows to define a hashtable containing fieldName / fieldValue combinations which represent the valueof a key (which can consist of more than one field, of course!)
example:
now, when a user calls aview.jsp?goto=234, then DbForms will navigate thetable to the row where id==234!
there are many other ways you can use this facility. the only important thing is thatthe key value(s) in the hashtables refer to valid field names of the table.
this attribute was added in release 0.9
this attribute allows a JSP view developer to trigger WebEvents(NavigationsEvents)on the JSP. No controller interaction is needed. This attribute aims to make linkagebetween dialogs easier.
currently, the available "local web event"-commands are:
if a developer wants to show the last row of a table, then she/he could applythe value "navNext" to this attribute. Note that this attribute is evaluated in runtime,this gives additional flexibility
this attribute was added in release 0.9
JavaScript event handler executed before the form is submited. If the event handler returns FALSE, the form will not be submitted. When the result is TRUE, the form will be submitted

tag.name: header
tag.summary: this tag renders a Header-tag. It should be nested within a dbform-tag

info.p: this tag renders a Header-tag. Itshould to be nested within a dbform-tag.because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag getsevaluated, but it gets only rendered at the FIRST evalation-loop.

tag.name: body
tag.summary: this tag renders a Body-tag. It should to be nested within a dbform-tag.

info.p: the body grouping tag

this tag renders a Body-tag. It should to be nested within a dbform-tag.because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag getsevaluated, AND it gets rendered in every evalation-loop (if there exists data to be rendered)

attribute.name: allowNew
attribute.info: by default this is "true" - if so, the body is rendered at least 1 time, even if there are no data rows in the table. this enables the user to insert a new data row. - to disable this feature, allowNew has to be set to "false"

tag.name: footer
tag.summary: the footer grouping tag. it is supposed to be nested within a dbform-tag

info.p: this tag renders a Footer-tag. it should be nested within a dbform-tag.because this tag is nested within a dbform-tag it is invoked every time the parent dbform-tag getsevaluated, but it gets only rendered at the end of the last evaluation-loop.

tag.name: label
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven LABEL, which is a passive element (it can't be changed bythe user) - it is predestinated for use with read-only data (i.e. primary keys you don't wantthe user to change, etc)
tag.info: label - can never be used as input field

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
Set a limit to the number of characters visible
If the value (retrieved from the database) is null, allow the user to replace the text to display by a custom value. May be used in conjunction with dbForm's I18N support.
If the value (retrieved from the database) is null, allow the user to replace the text to display by a custom value. May be used in conjunction with dbForm's I18N support.

summary.p: label - a tag for data PRESENTATION, NOT data EDITING (=> can never be used as input field)

info.p: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven LABEL, which is a passive element (it can't be changed bythe user) - it is predestinated for use with read-only data (i.e. primary keys you don't wantthe user to change, etc)

so far it is equivalent to DbLabelTag. But this tag may have a body containing any kind ofEmbeddedData - tag! this feature was put into a seperate class for performance reasons (we do not want the overheadof pushing and poping the jsp writer to and off the stack)
name of the field this tag references to
Set a limit to the number of characters visible
If the value (retrieved from the database) is null, allow the user to replace the text to display by a custom value. May be used in conjunction with dbForm's I18N support.

tag.name: textField
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven TEXTFIELD, which is an active element - the usercan change data

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
visually encrypted input field

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instanceis used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style.this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the providedFormat object

attribute.name: hidden
attribute.info: Determines if the text field should be hidden or displayed.

attribute.name: overrideValue
attribute.info: Defines the text field's default value. When this attribute is set,the value retrieved from the database is ignored.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum length of the string to be entered

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse click.

attribute.name: onDblClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse double click.

attribute.name: onFocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives inputfocus.

attribute.name: onKeyDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed.

attribute.name: onKeyPress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onKeyUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is released.

attribute.name: onMouseDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mousepointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onMouseMove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under themouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not underthe mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Size of the input field

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: dateField
tag.summary: this tag renders a dabase-datadriven DATE-FIELD, which is an active element - the usercan change data. it is very similar to TextField, but this class providesan extension to TextField: the additional attribute "dateFormat".

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instanceis used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style.this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the providedFormat object

even more convenient to use is the class java.text.SimpleDateFormat:
SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd");
"yyyy.MM.dd G 'at' hh:mm:ss z" => 1996.07.10 AD at 15:08:56 PDT
"EEE, MMM d, ''yy" => Wed, July 10, '96
"h:mm a" => 12:08 PM
"hh 'o''clock' a, zzzz" => 12 o'clock PM, Pacific Daylight Time
"K:mm a, z" => 0:00 PM, PST
"yyyyy.MMMMM.dd GGG hh:mm aaa " => 1996.July.10 AD 12:08 PM
(examples taken from Java API doc)
Determines if the text field should be hidden or displayed.
Defines the text field's default value. When this attribute is set,the value retrieved from the database is ignored.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum length of the string to be entered

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under themouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Size of the input field

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

attribute.name: useJsCalendar
attribute.info: Place small calendar icon after input field. Clicking that icon will popup a JavaScript calendar that can be used to set a new value for the field. Some preparations have to be done, the calendar must be copied into the web applications and must be included in current page. See dbforms manual for details.

attribute.name: jsCalendarDateFormat
attribute.info: Subpatterns inside date formats have sometimes different meanings in Java and inside JavaScript calendar. For some date formats it may be neccessary to explicitely set a date format to the calendar that corresponds to the used date format inside dbforms application. See dbforms manual for details.

tag.name: textArea
tag.summary: renders a HTML TEXTAREA element

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instanceis used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style.this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the providedFormat object

attribute.name: rows
attribute.info: how many rows does the textArea have

attribute.name: cols
attribute.info: how many columns does the textArea have

attribute.name: wrap
attribute.info:
may be:
"virtual" - text get wrapped optically
"phyiscal" - text get wrapped optically and physically (line breaks)

info.p: Defines the textarea's default value. When this attribute is set,the value retrieved from the database is ignored.

attribute.name: renderBody
attribute.info: if the content inside the body of this tag should be rendered or if the value of the associated field should be shown instead

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not underthe mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: textAreaForBlobs
tag.summary: renders a HTML TEXTAREA element
tag.info: i/o textarea for character diskblobs. use it if you want users to edit files using textareas

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

an instance of java.text.Format or any subclass of it. This instanceis used to force DbForms to print out the field's value using a certain formatting style.this is done internally by invoking method "format(Object)" of the providedFormat object

attribute.name: rows
attribute.info: how many rows does the textArea have

attribute.name: cols
attribute.info: how many columns does the textArea have

attribute.name: wrap
attribute.info:
may be:
"virtual" - text get wrapped optically
"phyiscal" - text get wrapped optically and physically (line breaks)

info.p: Defines the textarea's default value. When this attribute is set,the value retrieved from the database is ignored.

attribute.name: renderBody
attribute.info: if the content inside the body of this tag should be rendered or if the value of the associated field should be shown instead

attribute.name: suffix
attribute.info: suffix, e.g. jsp, xml, etc.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

tag.name: tableData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag!(useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data to radio, checkbox or select - tags. it may be used forcross references to other tables.
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

attribute.name: format
attribute.info: Allows you to define a format for concatenating individual fields

attribute.name: foreignTable
attribute.info: the name of the table whre

attribute.name: disableCache
attribute.info: Each query is executed independently

attribute.name: orderBy
attribute.info: Specify an orderby clause for the query

tag.name: queryData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag!(useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data (provided by query result) to radio, checkbox or select - tags.

this tag provides similar functionlaity like "TableData", but as it allows toformulate free querys including all SQL statements your RDBMS supports, you have muchmore flexibility using this tag than using TableData (which is easier to use, on the other hand)
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

attribute.name: format
attribute.info: Allows you to define a format for concatenating individual fields

info.p: the query used to retrieve the data

query building convention: first column is the "key" column for the radio/check/selectelements, all other colums are just "data" columns visible to the user
example: SELECT DISTINCT customer.id, customer.name, customer.adress, debitors.debit FROM customer INNER JOIN id ON (SELECT id FROM debitors WHERE debit>100000) ORDER BY debit DESC
- "id" will be threaten as key-value in select box, "name and address will be shown in select box

attribute.name: disableCache
attribute.info: Each query is executed independently

tag.name: staticData
tag.summary: external data to be nested into radio, checkbox or select - tag!(useful only in conjunction with radio, checkbox or select - tag)

info.p: this tag provides data to radio, checkbox or select - tags. This data is provided byembedded "StaticDataItem"-elements

this tag provides similar functionlaity like "TableData" or "QueryData" but as the namessuggest, the values of TableData and QueryData come from a database, the data in in StaticDataItem comes from the jsp page (from "StaticDataItem"-elements)
see examples!

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: an arbitrary id declared by the user - this id is useful, if the same data should be used more than once at one jsp page. using this unique name the system is able to chache the data

tag.name: staticDataItem
tag.summary: data to be nested into staticData element! (see description of staticData for further details)

tag.name: getConnection
tag.summary: Allows other tags (or scriptlets) to obtain a database connection object using the same settings found in dbForms-config.xml

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: Attribute in page that will be used to reference the connection object

tag.name: file
tag.summary: this tag renders an UPLOAD-button for uploading files into BLOBs or DISKBLOBs

info.p: version 0.7 provides a first implementation of file upload support. It is far from being completed. Improvementsin functionality and performance can be expected.

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
MIME(s)-types of the fields to be uploaded. you may use wildcards as well
example: accept="text/*" for text, htm, html,etc.
keep in mind that not all browsers support MIME type filtering.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

attribute.name: maxlength
attribute.info: Maximum length of the string to be entered

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse click.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: size
attribute.info: Size of the input field

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

tag.name: radio
tag.summary: renders a HTML RADIO element or a whole group of them

info.p: radio tag, may be a radio group as well and it may contain nested DbData-Tags(like tableData, queryData, staticData, ...)

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
value that sould be used as default when form is in insert mode.
only needed if form is in insert-mode, otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates the value.
determinates if this radio should be selected by default when form is in insert mode
only needed if form is in insert-mode, otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates whether a radio should be selected or not.

attribute.name: growDirection
attribute.info: for radio groups only: in which direction should the group grow: valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical"

attribute.name: growSize
attribute.info: Allows a developer to limit the number of elements per row by generating [TABLE] [TR] [TD] html tags.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse click.

attribute.name: onDblClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse double click.

attribute.name: onFocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives inputfocus.

attribute.name: onKeyDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed.

attribute.name: onKeyPress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onKeyUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is released.

attribute.name: onMouseDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mousepointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onMouseMove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under themouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not underthe mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: checkbox
tag.summary: renders a HTML CHECKBOX element or a whole group of them

info.p: radio tag, may be a radio group as well and it may contain nested DbData-Tags(like tableData, queryData, staticData, ...)

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
value that sould be used as default when form is in insert mode
only needed if parentForm is in "insert-mode", otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates the value.
determinates if this checkbox should be checked by default when form is in insert mode
only needed if parentForm is in "insert-mode", otherwise the DbForms-Framework determinates whether a checkbox should be selected or not.

attribute.name: growDirection
attribute.info: for checkbox groups only: in which direction should the group grow: valid values are "horizontal" and "vertical"

attribute.name: growSize
attribute.info: Allows a developer to limit the number of elements per row by generating [TABLE] [TR] [TD] html tags.

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse click.

attribute.name: onDblClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse double click.

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex

tag.name: select
tag.summary: This tag renders a html SELECT element including embedded OPTION elements.

info.p:
select tag, may contain nested "DbData"-Tags (OR "dboption" tags, which are not implemented yet)
examples for DbData-Tags are tableData, queryData, staticData

info
"dboption"- tags are expected for the next release

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

attribute.name: customEntry
attribute.info: Allows an additional (independant) entry into the select list

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
how many rows should the select box have

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

info.p: Rendering of read-only html widgets

attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects an item

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: readOnlyStyleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element (read-only mode).

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: linkURL
tag.summary: generates a link to a DbForms View
tag.info:
generates a link to a DbForms View. Setting the positionattribute will force DbForms to navigate to this position within the destination-table
the 3 examles below produce all the same result
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" position="103~2" />
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" position="<%= currentKey %>" />
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" >
<position field="id" value="103" />
<position field="cust_lang" value="2" />
</linkURL>

attribute.name: href
attribute.info: the url of the JSP file representing the view

attribute.name: tableName
attribute.info: the url of the table the view represents

attribute.name: position
attribute.info: optional: the position to navigate to within table "tableName"

tag.name: position
tag.summary: element to be embedded inside a linkURL-element
tag.info:
example:
<linkURL href="customer.jsp" table="customer" >
<position field="id" value="103" />
<position field="cust_lang" value="2" />
</linkURL>

attribute.name: fieldName
attribute.info: name of the key-field

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: value of the key field

tag.name: insertButton
tag.summary: this tag renders an INSERT-button

info.p: this tag renders an insert-button
the button is hidden if embedding form is not in insert mode

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the chosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the chosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: border
attribute.info: set html border attribute

info.p: site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUp-attribute of the parent form(s)!
site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUpOnError-attribute of the parent form(s)!

attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

tag.name: deleteButton
tag.summary: this tag renders a DELETE-button

info.p: delete button
the button is hidden if embedding form is in insert mode

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: border
attribute.info: set html border attribute

attribute.name: confirmMessage
attribute.info: This attribute will generate a javascript message asking if the user really wants to delete this entry. If the 'captionResource' attribute of the (db)Form is set to true, the message can be resolve from a ResourceBundle (ref: I18N)

info.p: site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUp-attribute of the parent form(s)!
site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUpOnError-attribute of the parent form(s)!
determinates the unique name of a data-row-marking "radio"-element (this MUST extist on thesame JSP - page as this button!
it should be used if this button should be rendered only once and not for every rowthat could/should be deleted
see "associatedRadio"-tag for further information!

this attribute over-rules the followUp-attribute of the parent form(s)!
site to be invoked after this button has been clicked and the associated actions are done
this attribute over-rules the followUpOnError-attribute of the parent form(s)!

attribute.name: accessKey
attribute.info: The keyboard character used to move focus immediately to thiselement.

attribute.name: onBlur
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus.

attribute.name: onChange
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element loses inputfocus and its value has changed.

attribute.name: onSelect
attribute.info: JavaScipt event hanlder executed when the user selects some text

attribute.name: onClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse click.

attribute.name: onDblClick
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives amouse double click.

attribute.name: onFocus
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element receives inputfocus.

attribute.name: onKeyDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed.

attribute.name: onKeyPress
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is depressed and released.

attribute.name: onKeyUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element has focus and akey is released.

attribute.name: onMouseDown
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under the mousepointer and a mouse button is depressed.

attribute.name: onMouseMove
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and the pointer is moved.

attribute.name: onMouseOut
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was under themouse pointer but the pointer was moved outside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseOver
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element was not underthe mouse pointer but the pointer is moved inside the element.

attribute.name: onMouseUp
attribute.info: JavaScript event handler executed when this element is under themouse pointer and a mouse button is released.

attribute.name: style
attribute.info: CSS styles to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: styleClass
attribute.info: CSS stylesheet class to be applied to this HTML element.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.info: The tab order (ascending positive integers) for this element.

tag.name: navNewButton
tag.summary: this tag renders a navigation button for creating a new row of data

info.p: navigation button to scroll to new, empty dataset
the "allowNew"-attribute of the parten "body"-tag MUEST NOT set to "false" in order to get this to work.

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

attribute.name: destTable
attribute.info: specify a table for insertion other than the parent table.

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: border
attribute.info: set html border attribute

tag.name: gotoButton
tag.summary: button for jumping to other jsp
tag.info: button for jumping to other jsp

attribute.name: id
attribute.info: expose id, enables interaction with JavaScript

attribute.name: flavor
attribute.info:
styling of the button choices:
standard a standard form button. if you use it you should specify "caption"
image an image-button. if you use it you should specify "src" and "alt"
modern a fancy button according to HTML4; dont use if no all of your users have got 5th-generation browsers! You may embed any code into this tag. (see docu or www.w3.org)

attribute.name: caption
attribute.info: caption of the button (use it if the chosen flavor is "standard")

attribute.name: src
attribute.info: source of the image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: alt
attribute.info: alternative to image (use it if the coosen flavor is "image")

attribute.name: border
attribute.info: set html border attribute

attribute.name: destination
attribute.info: the URL of the jsp-view to be invoked

attribute.name: destTable
attribute.info: the table of the toplevel form to jump to [may be deprecated soon]

attribute.name: destPos
attribute.info: a value indicating the row to navigate to (better description will come soon, after this tag is completely stable)

attribute.name: keyToDestPos
attribute.info: a key indicating the row to navigate to (better description will come soon, after this tag is completely stable)

attribute.name: keyToKeyToDestPos
attribute.info: the name of the "associatedRadio"- button used to identify a row. Check "customerlist.jsp" in example!

tag.name: base
tag.summary: renders a HTML-BASE tag

info.p: Renders a HTML "base" element with a "href"-attribute pointing to the absolute location of the enclosing JSP page. The presenceof this tag allows the browser to resolve relative URL's to images,CSS stylesheets and other resources in a manner independent of the URLused to call the ControllerServlet. You should use this tag in all your JSP-views (seeexamples in distribution)
There are no attributes associated withthis tag.

tag.name: errors
tag.summary: Custom tag that renders error messages if an appropriate request attributehas been created.

info.p: caption of the error-list
default = "Error:"
the name that should be used for retrieving the error-data from the session
default = "errors"

attribute.name: messagePrefix
attribute.info: The user may define a messagePrefix attribute to specify a delimiter. If defined, only the exception message after the delimeter iswritten out. This can be used to produce a user interface with nice, clean output. If the error tag does not contain a value formessagePrefix, the tag works as normal (prints out the exception information)NOTE: Deprecated as of v0.9e

tag.name: xmlErrors
tag.summary: Custom tag that renders error messages if an appropriate request attributehas been created. Used in conjuction with xml error manager

info.p: caption of the error-list
default = "Error:"
the name that should be used for retrieving the error-data from the session
default = "errors"

tag.name: hasMoreRecords
tag.summary: Verifies if the number of records in the result set is larger then the number specified

info.p: Number of records allowed
Message to display (see xml error manager)

tag.name: associatedRadio

summary.p: This tag enables the end-user to define a row by selecting the radio-buttonrendered by this tag

tag.info:
example: imagine a table "customer". The rows of this table should be listed. The user shouldbe able to delete a customer.
in that case the application developer has to alternatives:
to put a "deleteButton" into the body -> this button gets rendered for every row
if the user clicks the button the associated data row gets deleted.the disadvantage of this method is that multiple buttons must be rendered, which takes awaylots of space and makes layouting more difficult
to put an "associatedRadio" into the body and the "deleteButton" on the footer (or header)
the radio element gets rendered for every row, the deleteButton just once. if the user wantsto delete a row, he/she has to select the radioButton (to mark the row he/she wants to be deleted)and then to press the deleteButton.
the more buttons you have the better this method is!!
nota bene: you have to tell the delete (or insert, update...) - button that there exists an associatedradio button that marks the row the action should be applied to, by defining the "associatedRadio"attribute of that respective button.

info.p: a unique name for the radio box. this name is used by buttons like "deleteButton" or "updateButton"to lookup the valio of this radio!
see "deleteButton" or "updateButton" for further information!

summary.p: This tag generates an URL pointing to a servlet downloading the DISKBLOB referenced by fieldname

info.p: use cases:

ul.li: rendering an image: " alt="a picture">

info.p: name of the field this tag references to
name of the field this tag references to

summary.p: this tag rendes a select box for switching the order-state of a field (ascending, descending, none)
(this tag is full functional but still subject of change)

info.p: name of the field this tag references to

tag.name: style
tag.summary: generic style tag

info.p: name of the template to be included
part of the template to be invoked
parameter list used to specify rendering properties for the template

tag.name: templateParam
tag.summary: param name

info.p: name of the template param to evaluate

p.b: only used in template (_begin.jsp / _end.jsp) - definition files!

info.p: default value to choose if no value specified in paramList - attribute in the db:style tag of the embedded jsp

ul.li:
if the parameter describes a ressource then dir should be set to the directory containing thatresource. this attribute notes RELATIVE to the directory of the current template.
if your template is placed in /templates/mytemplate/ and you have images in a directory /templates/mytemplate/img/than just note dir as "img". if the images (or other resources) are in the /templates/mytemplateyou may set dir to "."

if you skip this attribute, then no directory will be written out. then only the actual valueof the param gets written out
(for example if the parameter is "bgcolor=#343434" then you definitly wouldnot want any directories to be involved!!

tag.name: templateBasedir
tag.summary: writes out base dir of the current template

p.b: only used in template (_begin.jsp / _end.jsp) - definition files!

tag.name: message
tag.summary: this tag renders a read-only text label. The data displayed is retrieved via a resource bundle and is locale-specific.

attribute.name: key
attribute.info: name of the key-field.

attribute.name: param
attribute.info: parameterlist for the message. Format: param1, param2, param3 message must be of the form: 'this is a message with parameter: {0}, {1}, {3} each occurence of {0} will be replaced with param1 and so on. This is the same mechanism wich is used in xmlErrors!

tag.name: javascriptArray
tag.summary: This tag was added to allow the generation of a javascript array from EmbeddedData.

attribute.name: name
attribute.info: name of the array.

tag.name: isWebEvent
tag.summary: Allows a developer to detect which type of event is being processed by the DbForms controller. The following events are currently available within dbForms: navFirst,navPrev, navNext, navLast, navNew, noop, goto, insert, update, delete

attribute.name: event
attribute.info: name of the event.

attribute.name: value
attribute.info: Condition in which to evaluate body. Default is set to true.

tag.name: pos
tag.summary: Renders a position to use with keyToDestPos. This is the same string wich would be used as value in the DbassociatedRadioTag.
